data.title: Position Opportunity: STEM Librarian, Louisiana State University – IUPUI Department of Library and Information Science
data.text:
For more information and to apply, click here.

The STEM librarian supports teaching and learning by teaching the information literacy concepts and promoting the understanding of the information ecosystem; uses discipline-specific expertise with STEM information sources to support research; develops relationships with faculty and staff to foster scholarly connections and collaboration; promotes the library’s role within STEM departments and other units on campus; advances librarianship with service, scholarship, and innovative practice.

Job Responsibilities

50% Serves as selector and subject specialist liaison for a range of disciplines within STEM fields. Provides outreach, instruction, and specialized services to faculty and students in those disciplines. Advocates for use of library services and resources. Seeks department and campus partnerships and collaborations. Develops discipline specific Web pages and other internet-based materials, such as tutorials and subject, topic, and course guides.

20% Identifies and locates data sets for researchers across disciplines; provides support for access and re-use conditions of data; identifies software/code to provide recommendations to researchers on re-use of data; provides recommendations to researchers regarding informatics, discovery, and analytical tools; provides support for data citation and referencing.

10% Provides general reference and information services through our AskUs service, chat, and in person interactions, as well library instruction for general sessions. Participates in library outreach and programming events.

15% Works to meet promotion and tenure requirements for research and service.

5% Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

Master’s (MLIS, MLS) degree from an ALA-accredited program.

1 year of relevant work experience

Experience working with STEM-related resources, particularly those relating to engineering and computer science. A degree in a STEM related field (Bachelor’s or Master’s) can substitute for experience.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a STEM field. Experience working with STEM-related resources as a library liaison, particularly those relating to engineering and computer science

Additional Job Description:

Special Instructions:

A copy of your transcript(s) may be attached to your application (if available). However, original transcripts are required prior to hire. Please provide three professional references including name, title, phone number and e-mail address. Please have three letters of recommendation available upon request.

LSU requires the COVID-19 vaccine for all students, faculty, and staff or mandatory monthly testing. New employees must either submit proof of vaccination within three (3) days of their official start date, otherwise be entered into the mandatory monthly testing protocol beginning in November 2021.
